editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
editorialNotes.short: Traverse mind-bending levels that are structurally impossible

editorialNotes.tagline: Join the battle for Bikini Bottom

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

editorialNotes.standard: It only takes about five minutes to realize just how strange Severed is. But to rescue your family, you’re going to have to dive right in, mastering the excellent swipe-based combat, travelling through a magical realm filled with danger, and—yeah—collecting some severed limbs. Like we said, it’s a little weird. But this Apple Design Award winner is also gorgeous, atmospheric, and totally memorable.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: A heart-wrenching world of life-or-death decision making.
editorialNotes.standard: A searing depiction of life in a combat zone, This War of Mine challenges you to keep a group of civilians alive until a ceasefire is declared. Figuring out who sleeps, who eats and who leaves your shelter each night to scavenge for supplies involves lots of tough decisions, but that’s just the beginning. While rummaging through hauntingly detailed ruins, you’ll meet equally desperate survivors and wrestle with your own conscience as you choose to help, trade or steal.

editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable
editorialNotes.standard: Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Use sound to escape the darkness
editorialNotes.standard: A chilling reminder that the threats you don’t see can be the most terrifying, Dark Echo drops you into a pitch-black room with only sounds and vague outlines to guide you. Before long, you’ll be clinging to every little noise and flash of light, hoping to avoid buzzing flies and angry growls. And when you finally reach the unlatching door that leads to the next area, you’ll feel an exhilarating jolt of pure glee.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Don’t be fooled by the cute visuals and quirky dialogue. Beneath the charming sheen, Warbits is a deceptively complex strategy game. As you make your way through a campaign packed with turn-based battles, you’re forced to make tough decisions. Do you try to stealthily capture an enemy base or wage a full-on assault and put your strongest units at risk? With a challenging campaign and several multiplayer game types (including a same-screen local mode!), your tactics will be put to the test.
editorialNotes.short: Devise complex strategies to come out on top.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.
Packed with great puzzles, humour, and voice acting–plus a thrilling murder mystery–this is everything you could want in a point-and-click adventure.

editorialNotes.tagline: Game 16. Help these critters get back home!
editorialNotes.standard: Typically when you love something, you don’t tear it up. But in this Apple Design Award winner, you’ll need to rip and rearrange each stage to help your lil’ alien buddies reach their spaceship. The design is superb, the music is wonderful. But hands-down the best thing about this puzzler? It feels totally original.
editorialNotes.short: Game 16. Help these critters get back home!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Something happened to your fellow children–and the only way to learn their fates is by sneaking past menacing shadows in this chilling 2D platformer.

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Put a little “boo” in your botany by concocting herbal remedies for odd supernatural ailments in this eerie puzzle-adventure.

Just from reading the title, you know your objective. But as you explore amazing paper-cutout landscapes, you’ll uncover a weird world dense with secrets and danger. Slick controls make traveling and harvesting food simple, but balancing your hunger and health—and sanity—requires crafting weapons, traps, machines and more. With tons of mysteries to uncover and challenges to complete, Don’t Starve will keep you enthralled.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.standard: Find food for your cubs in treacherous environments as the last living mother fox in this emotionally charged adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: In reimagining the classic Tomb Raider games, Square Enix built a turn-based puzzler that’s both true to its roots and completely fresh. This Apple Design Award winner pairs a gorgeous art style with super-fun gameplay where you avoid traps and collect relics. The experience feels so perfect for iOS, it was also our 2015 iPhone Game of the Year.

editorialNotes.tagline: A wild sprint to the finish

editorialNotes.short: Geneva Hodgson: Story editor, Donut County
editorialNotes.tagline: How deep does this hole go?

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernised battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Klei’s knack for building immersive worlds pays off big-time in Invisible, Inc. The techno-future vibe grabbed us from the get-go, and the hours whizzed by as we infiltrated corporations with our team of super-spies. A brilliant stealth game, its open-ended missions let you hack secrets, avoid detection, and use slick gadgets however you like.

name: Mystery Case Files: Ravenhearst Unlocked - A Hidden Object Adventure (Full)

editorialNotes.standard: Got time on your hands? In this brilliant indie gem, spend 400 days (real ones!) seeking solitary diversions before your giant sleeping boss wakes up.
